title: Sprint stand-up sarcasm
summary: Common memes about endless stand-ups or status meetings imply impatience with ritual updates.
guidance: Interpret as mild frustration about process overhead; suggest acknowledging the sentiment and offering a lighter agenda.

title: Burnout indicators
summary: Memes showing exhausted animals or skeletons on laptops usually poke fun at unsustainable workload.
guidance: Call out that teammates feel overworked and encourage discussing capacity or deadline adjustments.

title: Bug blame jokes
summary: Spider-Man pointing or Evil Kermit memes about bugs highlight finger-pointing in QA cycles.
guidance: Explain it as stress relief about regressions and steer toward collaborative debugging instead of blame.

title: Release train panic
summary: Exploding room or "this is fine" memes during release week dramatize unstable builds.
guidance: Frame it as anxiety about shipping quality; recommend triaging blockers and communicating risk openly.

title: Newcomer confusion
summary: Baby Yoda or confused math lady memes paired with acronyms show onboarding pain.
guidance: Interpret it as a request for clearer documentation or mentoring; suggest offering a cheat sheet or pairing session.

title: Victory laps
summary: Leonardo DiCaprio cheers or confetti gifs celebrate small wins after tough sprints.
guidance: Recognize the accomplishment and amplify the positive tone so the team keeps morale up.
